intro: Hemitelia brunoniana, commonly known as the New Zealand hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in forest understories and has glossy, dark green leaves. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used by Māori for various traditional purposes. Hemitelia brunoniana is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
